definition: a finger or toe in human beings or corresponding body part in other vertebrates
opposite_reasoning: InternalOrgan provides the strongest practical opposition for DigitAppendage with good availability. The external/peripheral vs internal/core anatomical distinction creates meaningful semantic distance while staying within the biological domain. This opposition captures the fundamental difference between extremities used for external interaction vs organs for internal bodily functions. While not directly relevant to AI safety concerns like deception, it provides a clean anatomical axis for concept space organization. The opposition is intuitive, well-established in both WordNet and SUMO, and doesn't require adding new concepts.
